S/4HANA Private Cloud or On premise S/4HANA setup:

In On premise S/4HANA (SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud) system, the multiple company mapping configure remains almost the same but with some additional business objects for replication. Also, in addition available rule types in S/4HANA Public cloud, here you can set up the rule type as Custom Logic. When Custom logic rule type is set for any object, the FSM Company identification happens based on custom code written (requires BAPI) in S/4HANA system.

Execute the below SPRO path for the multiple company configuration.

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Integration with Other SAP Solutions -> SAP Field Service Management -> Configure Multiple Company Replication

Below is the required configuration detail for each rule type.

Rule Type

Required Configuration Item

Custom Logic

No Configuration Required

All Companies

Define S/4HANA FSM Company,
Assign FSM Company Details

Plant / Sales Area / Purchasing Group / Company Code / Purchasing Org / Service Org

Define S/4HANA FSM Company,
Assign FSM Company Details,
Assign Relevant <Rule Type>

Specific Field

Define S/4HANA FSM Company,
Assign FSM Company Details,
Assign Relevant Fields

This completes the configuration required in the S/4HANA systems for the multiple company integration. Now, the mapping information should be synchronized to SAP Cloud Integration and few configurations should be enabled in the standard interfaces to make the multiple FSM company integration work.

To be continued‚Ä¶

Click on the below blog link for the second part: Part 2

entry.title: Seamless Multi-Company Data Replication in SAP Field Service Management ‚Äì Part 3
entry.content:
Custom Logic in Pre exits and Error Handling in Multiple FSM Company Replication in SAP Cloud Integration

In this blog part, I‚Äôll explain how to use custom exits within the multiple company fetch functionality of standard interfaces to determine the relevant FSM company. I‚Äôll also highlight the enhanced error handling introduced in SAP Cloud Integration as part of the multiple company integration feature.

Blog Series links:

Part 1 - Multiple Company integration overview and preparing S/4HANA systems for Multi-Company Integration

Part 2 - Configurations in CPI and Special handling of Business objects in Multiple Company integration

Part 3 - Achieving Multiple Company integration through custom logic implementation and enhanced error logging

Sometimes, the standard rule types provided by SAP‚Äîsuch as Sales Area, Company Code, etc‚Äîmay not fit your business requirements for identifying the FSM company. In such cases, you can implement your own custom logic to determine the FSM Company IDs and Account IDs for incoming data. This custom logic can be implemented in multiple ways, depending on your integration scenario and business needs.

.

Custom Logic Using Pre-Exits for Multiple Company in Standard Interfaces:

In the S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP FSM integration, you can leverage a pre-exit to determine FSM company details dynamically.

To enable this:

  1. In the standard interface where you want to apply custom logic, set the parameter Enable Pre-Exit MultiCompany to true.
  2. Create a Process Direct interface to implement your custom logic for setting FSM Account IDs and Company IDs.
  3. Apply your business rules to assign one or multiple companies as required.

This approach gives you flexibility to map FSM companies based on your specific business criteria before the data is sent to FSM.

 

Sample custom interface with custom logic to identify the FSM company and account id for the business partner object.

In the Groovy step ‚ÄúSet FSM Company details‚Äù, I have logic to different FSM account and company based on country code and for the FLCU01 role code. The identified FSM account and company details are appended to the same Business Partner message as in below format.

Similarly, this logic can be extended to any extent as per your requirement.

<FSMMultiCompany>
  <FSMCompany>accountid1|companyidA</FSMCompany>
  <FSMCompany>accountid1|companyidB</FSMCompany>
  .
  .
</FSMMultiCompany>

Later in the XSLT step ‚ÄúXSLT Group by FSM Company‚Äù, the message is grouped per FSM account and company Id pair using xml attribute ‚ÄúMultiCompanyGroup‚Äù as accountid|companyid. This group of data per each FSM account and company pair is required for the further processing of the data into each FSM company by the standard interface. More detail on how to group the message is provided in the following link Multiple Company Pre-Exits.

Final payload which sent back to standard Replicate Business Partner interface is as below. The standard interface will take care of posting the BP data to each FMS company in sequential batches.

In scenario of S/4HANA Private Cloud to SAP FSM integration scenario, you can either use the similar approach of using the pre exits provided for the multiple company fetch in the standard interfaces as shown above OR you can set the rule type as ‚ÄúCustom‚Äù in the S/4HANA multiple company configuration for the business object and implement a BADI to identify the FSM company ID in S4HANA.

 

Custom Logic Using Custom rule type in Multiple Company config in S/4HANA:

The Custom Logic rule type is available only for integration between SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and SAP Field Service Management (FSM).

This option allows you to determine the relevant FSM companies using your own code or logic instead of predefined rules. To use it:

  • Create an implementation for the BAdI CRMS4_FSM_RELV_COMP_DETERM.
  • Assign the Custom Logic rule type to the desired Replication Object, Attribute, and Attribute Value in the multiple company configuration.
  • Use the same combination as a filter in your BAdI implementation.
  • If Custom Logic is required for multiple replication objects, create a separate BAdI implementation for each.

Example: To configure custom logic for Sales Customers:

Step 1: Assign Custom Logic Rule Type

  • Replication Object: Business Partner (BP)
  • Replication Object Attribute: BP Role (02)
  • Replication Object Attribute Value: BP Customer ‚Äì Sales (FLCU01)

Step 2: Create BAdI Implementation with Filters

  • Replication Object (REPL_OBJECT): Business Partner (BP)
  • Replication Object Attribute (OBJ_ATR): BP Role (02)
  • Replication Object Attribute Value (OBJ_ATR_VAL): BP Customer ‚Äì Sales (FLCU01)

This approach gives you full flexibility to define custom company determination logic that fits your organization‚Äôs business rules, while keeping it aligned with the multiple company integration framework.

 

Enhanced Error Logging in Multi-Company integrations:

In multi-company integration scenarios, SAP Cloud Integration now provides enhanced error logging to simplify troubleshooting and root cause analysis.

When data errors occur during replication to SAP Field Service Management (FSM) companies, the system:

  • Creates attachments in the Message Processing Log (MPL) with detailed error information.
  • Records custom MPL headers indicating the FSM company for which the data failed to load.
  • Generates separate attachments for each FSM company, ensuring issue tracking is company-specific.

If an error is generic (not linked to a specific FSM company), it is still logged in a custom MPL header containing the company and account ID, along with relevant attachments.

Handling Missing Company Assignments

When no FSM company can be determined for an incoming replication object, the object is filtered out and not sent to any FSM company.

  • These filtered object IDs are recorded in a dedicated custom MPL header.
  • All attachment file names are suffixed with the corresponding FSM company ID.
  • If multiple companies are determined for one replication object, separate attachments are created for each.

 

Custom MPL Headers in Multi-Company Error Handling

Custom Header

Value

Purpose

FSMCompanyNotFoundForBusinessPartner

Business Partner ID

Logs BP ID filtered out due to no matching FSM company

FSMCompanyNotFoundForBusinessPartnerRelationWithContact

Business Partner ID | Contact ID

Logs BP & Contact IDs filtered out due to no matching FSM company

FSMCompanyNotFoundForProduct

Product ID

Logs Product ID filtered out due to no matching FSM company

FSMCompanyNotFoundForWarehouse

Product ID | Plant | Storage Location

Logs Product, Plant & Storage Location filtered out

FSMCompanyNotFoundForConditionRecord

Condition Record ID

Logs Condition Record ID filtered out

FSMCompanyNotFoundForServiceOrder

Service Order ID

Logs Service Order ID filtered out

BusinessPartnerFailedToLoad

Business Partner ID | FSM Company ID

Logs BP ID & company ID for FSM load errors

ContactFailedToLoad

Contact ID | FSM Company ID

Logs Contact ID & company ID for FSM load errors

BusinessPartnerRelationFailedToLoad

Contact ID | FSM Company ID

Logs Contact ID & company ID for relationship replication errors

ProductFailedtoLoad

Product ID | FSM Company ID

Logs Product ID & company ID for FSM load errors

WarehouseFailedtoLoad

Warehouse External ID

Logs Warehouse external ID & company ID for FSM load errors

ItemWarehouseFailedtoLoad

Item Warehouse External ID

Logs Item Warehouse external ID & company ID for FSM load errors

PriceListFailedtoLoad

Price List External ID

Logs Price List external ID & company ID for FSM load errors

ItemPriceListFailedtoLoad

Item | Price List ID

Logs Item & Price List external ID & company ID for FSM load errors

ServiceOrderFailedtoLoad

Service Order ID | FSM Company ID

Logs Service Order ID & company ID for FSM load errors

DataFailedtoLoad

FSM Account ID | FSM Company ID

Logs FSM account & company ID for non-FSM specific errors

 

This improved logging framework ensures that every failure‚Äîwhether company-specific or generic‚Äîis captured with context, allowing for faster resolution in complex multi-company setups.

Sample error logging snapshots:

entry.title: Re: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Malaysia Digita...
entry.content:
Hello , 

Thank you for the detailed explanation. We understand there are concerns regarding the current XML version in Public Cloud (v1.0) and the digital signature requirements applicable only in v1.1.

Following our latest discussions and verification with LHDN (IRBM):

  • Both v1.0 and v1.1 are currently accepted.
  • There is no official plan or timeline yet for mandatory migration from v1.0 to v1.1.

What this means for you:

  • You can continue using v1.0 without digital signatures and remain compliant.
  • Our team is reviewing how SAP DRC should handle certificate/key pair requirements in v1.0 scenarios to align with actual technical needs.
  • To avoid blocking your tests, you can generate a self-signed certificate and upload it under your TIN in the DRC Communication Settings. This will allow connections to IRBM to work.

We will share updates once a confirmed approach or enhancement is available for Public Cloud. In case you have further question, please contact the SAP support team via your usual channels. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Finance BCS Quarter closing impacted due to issue (du...
entry.content:
Hello @Girish_Jadhav49 

In BCS (Business Consolidation), auto-generated elimination entries cannot be deleted; instead, they must be reversed using the same elimination process that created them

  • Determine the specific elimination task or method responsible for creating the duplicate entry during the consolidation process monitor.
  • Re-execute the task in reversal mode for the relevant period, such as June 2025. This will generate the reversing entry.
  • Then, run the task again in normal mode to post the correct elimination entry.
  • If entries from previous periods, such as March 2025, were mistakenly reversed in June, you can fix this by creating a new manual consolidation journal or by modifying the task settings as needed.

This process uses the standard BCS workflow and does not require unsupported notes.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Association from picklist (Employee Class) to Generic...
entry.content:
Hello,

I understand your query regarding establishing a parent-child relationship between `Picklist` and a Generic Object. At this time, it is not feasible to create such a relationship either through an association or any other method.

To successfully establish a parent-child relationship, it is essential that both fields involved share the same data type. This means that both the parent and child fields must either be Generic Objects or Picklists.

Indumati

entry.title: Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to the blog post for asset management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release! This release delivers a series of targeted enhancements in maintenance management, aimed at improving operational workflows, data accuracy, and planning precision.

Table of Contents
  • New manage maintenance notification app (F5777)
  • E-mail reminders: Deadline monitoring for maintenance order flexible workflow
  • Partner and warranty support in manage material serial numbers app
  • Refresh button in manage maintenance backlog
  • Filter by plan status in manage maintenance items
  • Copy maintenance plan in manage maintenance plans
  • Display warranty details in maintenance order apps
  • Supplier material number in maintenance order apps
  • Authorization group field in maintenance plan migration template
  • System condition at operation level in task list odata API
  • C1 release of CDS view for task list operations with PRT
  • Origin indicator in measurement document API

More information / additional links

Before delving into each feature, I invite you to watch the release highlights video below. This time, my digital twin presents what is new for Asset Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release:

 

Let‚Äôs start with the first three innovations showcased in the video above

New manage maintenance notification app (F5777)

The brand-new ‚ÄúManage Maintenance Notification‚Äù app (F5777) consolidates the entire maintenance notification lifecycle into a single, role-based Fiori application. It replaces multiple legacy apps by offering a unified interface for creation, screening, editing, and follow-up actions. Users can now create notifications in draft mode, scan equipment barcodes, attach documents, and assign task lists or orders, all within one app.

The app supports notifications of types M1, M2, and M3, and introduces flexible role handling, allowing users with multiple responsibilities to operate without switching roles. Additionally, a new BAdI enables dynamic UI field control, allowing fields to be made mandatory or read-only based on context, such as notification priority or subphase.

This app significantly streamlines maintenance processes, enhances user productivity, and supports extensibility through custom logic.

Watch the demo below to learn more details with Akif √únal:

 

Back to table of contents

E-mail reminders: Deadline monitoring for maintenance order flexible workflow

To improve workflow compliance and reduce delays in order approvals, SAP has introduced deadline monitoring for maintenance order workflows. This feature ensures that approvers are reminded to act on pending workflow items either through visual indicators in the SAP inbox or via email alerts.

The email notification mechanism is configurable during workflow definition and uses a standard SAP template, which customers can customize through the extensibility framework. By enabling proactive alerts, this enhancement helps prevent bottlenecks in maintenance execution, supports SLA adherence, and improves overall workflow responsiveness.

Watch the demo below to learn more details with Akif √únal:

 

Back to table of contents

Partner and warranty support in manage material serial numbers app

The Manage Material Serial Numbers (F6879) app has been enhanced to support the assignment of both partner and warranty details to serialized materials. Users can now select partner functions and IDs using F4 value help, linking business partners directly to serial numbers. Additionally, warranty information (including type, master warranty number, validity dates, and inheritance flags) can be assigned to each serial number.

This capability strengthens asset traceability and ensures that warranty entitlements and partner responsibilities are clearly defined at the serial number level. It‚Äôs particularly valuable for industries with serialized equipment and complex service networks.

Watch the demo below to learn more details:

 

Back to table of contents

Now, moving to further innovations for 2508 release:

Refresh button in manage maintenance backlog

In the Manage Maintenance Backlog Fiori app (F4073), a new refresh button has been introduced to allow users to update the list of orders within a specific bucket without reloading the entire page. Previously, when an order‚Äôs status changed, such as resolving an issue that had marked it red, the application did not reflect the update unless the user performed a full-page refresh.

This enhancement enables a table-level refresh, fetching the latest status directly from the backend and updating the UI accordingly. The result is a smoother user experience, faster validation of order changes, and improved data accuracy, especially in high-volume maintenance environments. This change supports more responsive backlog management and reduces unnecessary page reloads, which can be disruptive in operational contexts.

Refresh button in manage maintenance backlog

Back to table of contents

Filter by plan status in manage maintenance items

The Manage Maintenance Items app (F5356) now supports filtering based on Maintenance Plan Status, allowing users to isolate items by their lifecycle state. Available filter options include "Created", "Inactive", and "Deletion Flag". It‚Äôs important to note that "Scheduled" is treated as "Created" since it is a calculated status rather than a system-defined one.

This enhancement enables maintenance planners and technicians to focus on relevant items, avoid processing those marked for deletion, and streamline planning activities by narrowing down the dataset to actionable entries. By introducing this filter, we improve the precision of maintenance item selection and supports better decision-making in planning and execution phases.

Watch the demo below to learn more details:

 

Back to table of contents

Copy maintenance plan in manage maintenance plans

The Manage Maintenance Plans (F5325) app now supports direct copying of maintenance plans, streamlining the creation of similar plans without relying on predefined templates. Unlike the Process Maintenance Plans app, which required users to create and use copy templates, this enhancement allows any maintenance plan to be copied flexibly from the list page.

Users can select a plan, initiate the copy action, and define parameters such as scheduling options, maintenance items, and object lists. The copied plan is created in draft mode, allowing for review and adjustments before finalization. This feature simplifies plan replication, reduces setup time, and supports faster onboarding of new assets or maintenance strategies.

Watch the demo below to learn more details:

 

Back to table of contents

Display warranty details in maintenance order apps

Maintenance technicians and planners can now view warranty information for technical objects directly within the Create, Change, and Display Maintenance Order applications, also in Fiori interface. A new "show warranty" button reveals warranty details associated with the technical object linked to the order.

This visibility allows users to quickly assess whether a component is under warranty before initiating repairs or replacements, potentially reducing costs and avoiding unnecessary work. The integration of warranty data into the order context enhances decision-making and supports more informed maintenance planning.

2. Display warranty details in maintenance order apps

Back to table of contents

Supplier material number in maintenance order apps

Maintenance Order applications (Create, Change, Display, and Find) now support the display and update of Supplier Material Numbers (SMN) within the "Material and Services" tab. This enhancement ensures that supplier-specific part numbers are visible and traceable throughout the maintenance process.

By integrating SMNs into the order context, SAP enables better alignment with procurement documents such as purchase requisitions and purchase orders, where supplier part numbers are often critical. This feature enhances traceability, reduces errors in material identification, and supports smoother collaboration with external vendors.

3. Supplier material number in maintenance order apps

Back to table of contents

Authorization group field in maintenance plan migration template

The Maintenance Plan migration template has been enhanced to include the Authorization Group (BEGRP) field, along with fields for scheduling end date and end counter. These additions allow customers to migrate maintenance plans from external systems while preserving access control and scheduling boundaries.

This is particularly beneficial for organizations transitioning from ECC or legacy ERP systems that used authorization groups to restrict access to specific plans. By enabling these fields in the migration template, SAP reduces the need for post-migration mass updates and supports a more secure and complete data transfer process.

System condition at operation level in task list odata API

In previous releases, the "System Condition" field was not available at the operation level in the Task List OData API, limiting the ability to retrieve this critical information. With the 2508 release, this field has been added to the API, allowing external systems and custom applications to access system condition data for each operation.

This enhancement improves integration capabilities and supports more detailed analysis and automation scenarios, especially in environments where system condition influences task execution or prioritization.

C1 release of CDS view for task list operations with PRT

SAP has introduced a new C1-released CDS view to support the extraction of task list operations along with their assigned Production Resource Tools (PRTs). This view is derived from the I_MaintTaskListOpPRT CDS and includes the most relevant fields consolidated into an intermediary analytical view.

Previously, customers lacked a standard report or app to bulk retrieve this data. The new CDS view addresses this gap, enabling efficient reporting and integration for maintenance planning and execution. It provides a structured way to access task list and PRT data, supporting better resource allocation and operational transparency.

Origin indicator in measurement document API

The Measurement Document API has been enhanced to include the "MeasurementDocumentOrigin" property, which indicates the source of a measurement entry. This field allows systems to distinguish between manually entered readings, API-based entries, batch inputs, and other origins.

By exposing this metadata, we enable more transparent data tracking and supports future use cases where the origin of a measurement may influence validation, reporting, or automation logic. This enhancement improves data governance and supports integration scenarios where origin traceability is essential.

Learn more about it: API Reference | Measurement Document | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Back to table of contents

More Information / Additional Links 

You will find a collection of SAP S/4HANA Cloud product centric blog posts here:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Asset Management ‚Äì The Link Collection
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Manufacturing & Supply Chain - The Link Collection
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud for Supply Chain - The Link Collection
  • Discrete Industries in SAP S/4HANA Cloud - The Link Collection
